description: Borrowed from French milieu (“physical or social environment; group of people with a common point of view”), from Middle French milieu, meilleu, mileu, from Old French milliu, meillieu, mileu (“middle”), from mi- (prefix meaning ‘half’) (from Latin medius (“half; middle”), possibly ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *me (“around; by; in the middle of; near; with”)) + lieu, leu (“place”) (from Latin locus (“place; spot (specific location)”), ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *stel- (“to locate; to place, put; to be stiff”)).

entries.meaning: An environment or setting; a medium.
A group of people with a common point of view; a social class or group.
